result.execSummary:
The defendant David K Chapin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David K Chapin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David K Chapin was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: any probation currently on.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David K Chapin

11:54 No appearance by Mr. Chapin, no appearance by DA, or probation agent.  Defendant set to release from probation, owes $185.86, court: defendant exntended on probation for a year, if defendant pays he may be dishcarged from probation.  If payment is not made before Feb 28, 2017 probation extended 1 year. Judge will need to sign the Order on or before February 28, 2017, if defendant has paid by then defendant can be discharged. records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 8:35 Defendant David K Chapin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: dismiss Ct#1. guilty to Ct#2. 1 year probation concurrent with any probation currently on. Bub and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Court motions were filed to dismiss Ct#1 previously, but never dealt with so Court dismisses Ct#1 based on agreement. Froelich, Bub and Def agree. Def was in the armed services.  Def pleas guilty to Ct#2; Bub stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Froelich and Bub address sentencing. Court: S/W 1 year probation; concurrent to any probation on. conditions: court costs, any conditions set forth by Agent.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Notice and Order to Provide Biological Specimen
to continue plea hearing so Defendant my attend to a medical issue filed by Atty Bub.

03:07 Defendant David K Chapin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's Atty C Bub files Motion to Dismiss. Court addresses Atty Bub. Atty Froelich addresses the Court regarding jurisdiction. Atty Froelich calls Investigator Kristopher Stewart. Investigator Kristopher Stewart is sw and ex by Atty Froelich. Investigator Stewart id's defendant David K Chapin. Atty C Bub xexam Investigator Stewart. Court addresses parties.  Atty Bub addresses the Court. Court gives parties 30 days to file briefs regarding jurisdiction. 3:32

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 10:18 Defendant David K Chapin in court with attorney Julie Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $5000 signature bond with prints/photo and no contact Mark and Lori Gustafson. Nelson: no objection to bond requests. Def was in the army.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
